measures.number: Establish Campaign Contribution Limits for State and Local Elections Initiative
measures.title: Establish Campaign Contribution Limits for State and Local Elections Initiative
measures.description: Establish new campaign contribution limits for campaigns for state and local office. This citizen-initiated measure is on the Alaska 2026 ballot.

measures.title: Repeal Top-Four Ranked-Choice Voting Initiative
measures.description: Repeal the top-four ranked-choice voting (RCV) system that was adopted in 2020. This citizen-initiated measure is on the Alaska 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Allow Judges to Deny Bail for Certain Weapon Discharges and Attempted or Planned Murder Amendment
measures.title: Allow Judges to Deny Bail for Certain Weapon Discharges and Attempted or Planned Murder Amendment
measures.description: Add discharging a firearm in an occupied dwelling or other occupied space and any solicitation, attempt, or conspiracy to commit murder to the list of crimes for which a judge may deny bail. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Alabama 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Prohibit Diminishing District Attorney Compensation During Term of Office Amendment
measures.title: Prohibit Diminishing District Attorney Compensation During Term of Office Amendment
measures.description: Prohibit any reduction in a district attorney's compensation during their term in office. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Alabama 2026 ballot.

measures.title: Citizenship Requirement for Voting Amendment
measures.description: Provide that only U.S. citizens may vote in state or local elections. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Arkansas 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Creation of Economic Development Districts Amendment
measures.title: Creation of Economic Development Districts Amendment
measures.description: Allow the legislature to create programs, including Economic Development Districts, and make loans and grants of public money to develop the state economy. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Arkansas 2026 ballot.
measures.category: Local government; Local government; Economic investment

measures.title: Natural Resources Commission Bond Measure
measures.description: Authorize the Arkansas Natural Resources Commission to issue up to $500 million in general obligation bonds to fund water-related infrastructure projects including water treatment and transportation, waste disposal, pollution abatement, drainage, irrigation, flood control, and wetlands and aquatic resources infrastructure. This legislative referendum is on the Arkansas 2026 ballot.
measures.category: Flood infrastructure; Storm infrastructure; Irrigation; Sewage and stormwater; Pollution; Parks and conservation; Bonds

measures.number: Right to Keep and Bear Arms Amendment
measures.title: Right to Keep and Bear Arms Amendment
measures.description: Provide that the right to keep and bear arms is "a natural, fundamental, and individual right that shall not be infringed". This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Arkansas 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Designate Drug Cartels as Terrorist Organizations and Require State DHS to Address Threats Measure
measures.title: Designate Drug Cartels as Terrorist Organizations and Require State DHS to Address Threats Measure
measures.description: Declare drug cartels to be terrorist organizations. This legislative referendum is on the Arizona 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Limit Local Tax Rate on Groceries to 2% of Base Price and Require Voter Approval to Increase Tax Rate Measure
measures.title: Limit Local Tax Rate on Groceries to 2% of Base Price and Require Voter Approval to Increase Tax Rate Measure
measures.description: Prohibit local government from imposing or increasing a tax on the sale of food items without voter approval and cap the tax rate at 2%. This legislative referendum is on the Arizona 2026 ballot.
measures.category: Ballot measures; Food and beverage taxes; Sales taxes

measures.number: Prohibit Taxes or Fees on Miles Traveled in Motor Vehicle Amendment
measures.title: Prohibit Taxes or Fees on Miles Traveled in Motor Vehicle Amendment
measures.description: Prohibit the state and local governments from imposing taxes or fees based on vehicle miles traveled and from enacting rules to monitor or limit vehicle miles traveled without the person’s consent. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Arizona 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Allow Public Financing of Election Campaigns Measure
measures.title: Allow Public Financing of Election Campaigns Measure
measures.description: Allow the state and local governments to create programs that provide candidates with public funds under spending limits and eligibility rules. This legislative referendum is on the California 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Eliminate Successor Election at a State Officer Recall Election Amendment
measures.title: Eliminate Successor Election at a State Officer Recall Election Amendment
measures.description: Eliminate the successor election when a state officer is recalled, thereby leaving the office vacant until it is filled according to state law. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the California 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Vote Requirements for Initiatives Requiring Supermajority Votes Amendment
measures.title: Vote Requirements for Initiatives Requiring Supermajority Votes Amendment
measures.description: Require initiatives that change vote thresholds to supermajority votes to pass by the same vote requirement as is being proposed. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the California 2026 ballot.

measures.title: Initiative 85
measures.description: Increase penalties for fentanyl-related felonies, require treatment for certain drug offenses, and limit sentencing exceptions in fentanyl-related crimes that cause another person’s death. This citizen-initiated measure is on the Colorado 2026 ballot.

measures.title: Initiative 95
measures.description: Require law enforcement to notify the U.S. Department of Homeland Security when a person is charged with a crime of violence or has a prior felony conviction and the person’s immigration status cannot be determined. This citizen-initiated measure is on the Colorado 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Changes to Budget Stabilization Fund Amendment
measures.title: Changes to Budget Stabilization Fund Amendment
measures.description: Increase the amount of funds that may be retained in the budget stabilization fund from 10% to 25% of net general revenue among other changes. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Florida 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Exempt Tangible Personal Property Used for Agriculture or Agritourism from Property Taxes Amendment
measures.title: Exempt Tangible Personal Property Used for Agriculture or Agritourism from Property Taxes Amendment
measures.description: Exempt agricultural-related tangible personal property, such as farm equipment or tools, from property taxes. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Florida 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Increase Acre Limit for Agriculture and Timber Conservation Use Property Tax Classification Amendment
measures.title: Increase Acre Limit for Agriculture and Timber Conservation Use Property Tax Classification Amendment
measures.description: Increase the maximum acreage of agricultural and timber property that can be classified as bona fide conservation use property, which is taxed at 40% of the land's value, from 2,000 acres to 4,000 acres. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Georgia 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Increase Time for Senate to Act on Judicial Appointments Amendment
measures.title: Increase Time for Senate to Act on Judicial Appointments Amendment
measures.description: Increase the timeframe for the Senate to consider and act on appointments of judges and justices from 30 days to 60 days for appointments made between April 1 and December 31 when the Senate is not in regular session or is soon to adjourn the regular session. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Hawaii 2026 ballot.

measures.title: HJR 4
measures.description: Provide that only the state legislature has the authority to legalize marijuana, narcotics, or other psychoactive substances. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Idaho 2026 ballot.
measures.category: Psychedelics; Initiative process; Legislature; Marijuana; Drug crime

measures.title: HJR 6
measures.description: Add constitutional language designating English as the official language of Idaho. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Idaho 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Residency Requirements for City and Town Court Judges Amendment
measures.title: Residency Requirements for City and Town Court Judges Amendment
measures.description: Require city and town court judges to reside in either the county where the court is located or the bordering county closest to the court. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Indiana 2026 ballot.

measures.title: Citizenship Voting Requirement Amendment
measures.description: Amend the state constitution to state that only a citizen of the United States is eligible to vote. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Kansas 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Elections for Supreme Court Justices Amendment
measures.title: Elections for Supreme Court Justices Amendment
measures.description: Make the Kansas Supreme Court an elected office and to abolish the court's nominating commission. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Kansas 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Allow Parishes to Exempt Business Inventory from Property Taxation Amendment
measures.title: Allow Parishes to Exempt Business Inventory from Property Taxation Amendment
measures.description: Allow parishes to exempt business inventory from property taxes. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Louisiana 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Increase Judicial Retirement Age to 75 Years Amendment
measures.title: Increase Judicial Retirement Age to 75 Years Amendment
measures.description: Increase the judicial retirement age from 70 to 75. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Louisiana 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Legislative Authority to Add or Remove Unclassified Civil Service Positions Amendment
measures.title: Legislative Authority to Add or Remove Unclassified Civil Service Positions Amendment
measures.description: Allow the legislature to add officers, positions, and employees to the unclassified civil service. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Louisiana 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Raise Income Limit to $150,000 for Special Property Tax Assessment Amendment
measures.title: Raise Income Limit to $150,000 for Special Property Tax Assessment Amendment
measures.description: Raise the income limit to qualify for the property tax special assessment level from $100,000 to $150,000. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Louisiana 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Repeal Certain Funds and Dedicate Revenues to Teachers' Retirement System Amendment
measures.title: Repeal Certain Funds and Dedicate Revenues to Teachers' Retirement System Amendment
measures.description: Repeal the three education revenue funds and apply that money to the Teachers' Retirement System. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Louisiana 2026 ballot.
measures.category: Teachers; Public retirement funds; Restricted-use funds

measures.number: St. George Community School System Authority Amendment
measures.title: St. George Community School System Authority Amendment
measures.description: Add the St. George Community School System to the list of school systems that are regarded and treated as parishes for purposes of operating a school system. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Louisiana 2026 ballot.

measures.title: Firearm Regulations Referendum
measures.description: Uphold the legislation, An Act Modernizing Firearm Laws (H. 4885), passed in 2024. This citizen-initiated measure is on the Massachusetts 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Commission on Judicial Disabilities Vacancies Amendment
measures.title: Commission on Judicial Disabilities Vacancies Amendment
measures.description: Allow the chair of the Commission on Judicial Disabilities to appoint former members to temporarily fill vacancies or allow the governor to appoint a substitute member or extend the term of an existing member. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Maryland 2026 ballot.

measures.title: Constitutional Convention Question
measures.description: Asks voters whether to hold a state constitutional convention. This advisory question is on the Michigan 2026 ballot.

measures.title: Amendment 1
measures.description: Renew the existing sales and use tax of 0.1% for 10 years to fund state parks and soil and water conservation. This legislative referendum is on the Missouri 2026 ballot.

measures.title: Amendment 2
measures.description: Require the Jackson County Assessor to be an elected position. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Missouri 2026 ballot.

measures.title: Amendment 3
measures.description: Prohibit abortion in most cases, and prohibit gender transition procedures for minors under eighteen. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Missouri 2026 ballot.
measures.category: Sex and gender; LGBTQ; Constitutional rights; Healthcare governance; Abortion

measures.title: Amendment 4
measures.description: Require the majority of voters from each congressional district to approve initiative petitions to amend the constitution, prohibit foreign nationals from contributing to ballot measure campaigns, among other provisions. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Missouri 2026 ballot.
measures.category: Supermajority; Initiative process; Ballot measures; Campaign finance

measures.title: Require Voter Identification Amendment
measures.description: Require photographic identification to vote for all voters, not just those voting in person. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the North Carolina 2026 ballot.

measures.number: 60% Vote Requirement for Constitutional Amendments Measure
measures.title: 60% Vote Requirement for Constitutional Amendments Measure
measures.description: Require constitutional amendments to receive a 60% supermajority vote to be adopted. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the North Dakota 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Changes to State Legislative Term Limits Amendment
measures.title: Changes to State Legislative Term Limits Amendment
measures.description: Establish term limits for state legislators of four complete four-year terms in the state legislature regardless of chamber; provide that a term that is less than four-years does not count toward the term limit; repeal the constitutional provision established by Constitutional Measure 1 of 2022 which provided that term limits could only be amended or repealed by initiative petition and not by the state legislature. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the North Dakota 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Single-Subject Requirement for Constitutional Amendments Measure
measures.title: Single-Subject Requirement for Constitutional Amendments Measure
measures.description: Create a single-subject requirement for initiated constitutional amendments and legislatively referred constitutional amendments in North Dakota. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the North Dakota 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Change State Legislative Term Limits from Two to Three Consecutive Terms Amendment
measures.title: Change State Legislative Term Limits from Two to Three Consecutive Terms Amendment
measures.description: Change the legislative term limit from two consecutive four-year terms to three. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Nebraska 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Eliminate Governor’s Pocket Veto and Require Veto Explanations Amendment
measures.title: Eliminate Governor’s Pocket Veto and Require Veto Explanations Amendment
measures.description: Require bills to become law if the governor does not sign or veto them within the required timeframe, eliminating the governor's pocket veto. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the New Mexico 2026 ballot.

measures.title: Question 6
measures.description: Provide for a state constitutional right to abortion before fetal viability. This citizen-initiated measure is on the Nevada 2026 ballot.

measures.title: Question 7
measures.description: Require voters to present photo identification when voting in person or to provide the last four digits of their driver’s license or Social Security number when voting by mail. This citizen-initiated measure is on the Nevada 2026 ballot.

measures.title: State Question 832
measures.description: Increase the minimum wage to $15.00 per hour. This citizen-initiated measure is on the Oklahoma 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Increase to Gas Tax, Payroll Tax, and Vehicle Registration Fees Referendum
measures.title: Increase to Gas Tax, Payroll Tax, and Vehicle Registration Fees Referendum
measures.description: Repeal sections of House Bill 3991 that increase the state's gas tax, payroll tax, and vehicle registration fees. This citizen-initiated measure is on the Oregon 2026 ballot.
measures.category: Business taxes; Fuel taxes; Transportation taxes

measures.title: Constitutional Amendment I
measures.description: Condition Medicaid expansion on federal funding remaining at least 90%. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the South Dakota 2026 ballot.

measures.title: Constitutional Amendment J
measures.description: Provide that "[an] individual who is not a citizen of the United States is disqualified from voting in any election or upon any question submitted to the voters". This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the South Dakota 2026 ballot.

measures.title: Constitutional Amendment K
measures.description: Establish an unclaimed property trust fund. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the South Dakota 2026 ballot.

measures.title: Constitutional Amendment L
measures.description: Require a 60% majority by voters to approve constitutional amendments. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the South Dakota 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Marsy's Law Crime Victims Rights Amendment
measures.title: Marsy's Law Crime Victims Rights Amendment
measures.description: Amend the list of crime victims' rights in the constitution. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Tennessee 2026 ballot.

measures.title: Prohibit State Property Taxes Amendment
measures.description: Prohibit the legislature from enacting taxes on property. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Tennessee 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Remove Right to Bail for Certain Criminal Offenses Amendment
measures.title: Remove Right to Bail for Certain Criminal Offenses Amendment
measures.description: Remove the right to bail for specified criminal offenses. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Tennessee 2026 ballot.

measures.number: 60% Vote Requirement for Ballot Initiatives to Increase or Expand Taxes Amendment
measures.title: 60% Vote Requirement for Ballot Initiatives to Increase or Expand Taxes Amendment
measures.description: Require a supermajority requirement of 60% by voters for citizen-initiated ballot measures that create new taxes, increase existing tax rates, or for a property tax. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Utah 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Publication Requirements for Constitutional Amendments Measure
measures.title: Publication Requirements for Constitutional Amendments Measure
measures.description: Require that constitutional amendments appearing on the ballot must be published for a period of 60 days. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Utah 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Remove Constitutional Same-Sex Marriage Ban Amendment
measures.title: Remove Constitutional Same-Sex Marriage Ban Amendment
measures.description: Repeal the provision defining marriage as between one man and one woman and prohibit the state from denying a marriage license to two adult persons based on sex, gender, or race. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Virginia 2026 ballot.
measures.category: Sex and gender; LGBTQ; Race and ethnicity; Constitutional rights; Family

measures.title: Right to Reproductive Freedom Amendment
measures.description: Provide a state constitutional right to reproductive freedom, defined as "the right to make and effectuate one's own decisions about all matters related to one's pregnancy". This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Virginia 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Use of Legislative Congressional Redistricting Map Amendment
measures.title: Use of Legislative Congressional Redistricting Map Amendment
measures.description: Allow the state legislature to conduct congressional redistricting between 2025 and 2030. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Virginia 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Voting Rights Restoration for Felons Upon Release Amendment
measures.title: Voting Rights Restoration for Felons Upon Release Amendment
measures.description: Provide for the restoration of voting rights to individuals convicted of felonies upon release from incarceration. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Virginia 2026 ballot.

measures.title: Proposal 3
measures.description: Establish a state constitutional right to organize or join a labor organization for the purpose of collective bargaining. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Vermont 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Prohibit Government Closure of Places of Worship During Emergencies Amendment
measures.title: Prohibit Government Closure of Places of Worship During Emergencies Amendment
measures.description: Prohibit the government from closing gatherings at places of worship during declared emergencies, including public health emergencies. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Wisconsin 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Prohibit Government Discrimination or Preferential Treatment Amendment
measures.title: Prohibit Government Discrimination or Preferential Treatment Amendment
measures.description: Prohibit the government from discriminating or granting preferential treatment based on race, sex, color, ethnicity, or national origin. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Wisconsin 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Homeowner's Primary Residence Property Tax Exemption Initiative
measures.title: Homeowner's Primary Residence Property Tax Exemption Initiative
measures.description: Create a homeowner's property tax exemption that exempts 50% of a primary residence's assessed value from property taxation. This citizen-initiated measure is on the Wyoming 2026 ballot.
measures.category: Property taxes; Homestead tax; Tax exemptions

measures.title: Proposition 50
measures.description: Allow the state to use a new, legislature-drawn congressional district map for 2026 through 2030. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the California 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 64.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition LL
measures.description: Allow the state to keep $12.4 million in excess revenue and interest from reduced state income tax deductions under Proposition FF (2022) to provide funding for the Healthy School Meals for All Program. This legislative referendum was placed on the Colorado 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 66.0% voting yes.
measures.category: Public assistance; Public education funding; Food; Income taxes

measures.title: Proposition MM
measures.description: Reduce state income tax deductions for taxpayers earning $300,000 or more to generate additional revenue for the Healthy School Meals for All Program and, once the program is funded with reserves, for SNAP. This legislative referendum was placed on the Colorado 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 60.0% voting yes.
measures.category: Public assistance; Public education funding; Food; Income taxes

measures.title: Amendment 1
measures.description: Allow the legislature to establish trial courts with limited or specialized jurisdiction, such as business courts, through a two-thirds vote. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Louisiana 2025 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 35.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Amendment 2
measures.description: Revise state constitutional provisions governing tax policy and various state funds. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Louisiana 2025 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 35.0% voting yes.
measures.category: Severance taxes; Public education funding; Income taxes; Property taxes; Sales taxes; Teachers; Tax exemptions; Public retirement funds; Budget stabilization; Restricted-use funds; Revenue and spending limits; Legislature

measures.title: Amendment 3
measures.description: Provide the state legislature with the authority to determine in state law which crimes can result in a juvenile being tried as an adult; removes list of crimes currently in the state constitution for which juveniles can be tried as adults. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Louisiana 2025 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 34.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Amendment 4
measures.description: Provide that judicial vacancies should be filled by calling a special election at the earliest available date pursuant to state law, rather than current law, which provides for calling a special election within twelve months after the day the vacancy occurs. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Louisiana 2025 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 36.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Question 1
measures.description: Require voter photo identification and make changes to absentee voting and ballot drop box rules. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the Maine 2025 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 36.0% voting yes.
measures.category: Election administration; Absentee voting; Voter ID

measures.title: Question 2
measures.description: Establish a process for obtaining an Extreme Risk Protection Order (ERPO). This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the Maine 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 63.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposal 1
measures.description: Authorize the state to use up to 323 acres of forest preserve land at the Mount Van Hoevenberg Olympic Sports Complex. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the New York 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 52.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Issue 2
measures.description: Allow the state to issue up to $2.5 billion in general obligation bonds to assist local governments in funding public infrastructure improvement projects. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Ohio 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 68.0% voting yes.
measures.category: Local government; Drinking water; Sewage and stormwater; Pollution; Highways; Bonds

measures.title: Proposition 1
measures.description: Establish the Permanent Technical Institution Infrastructure Fund (Permanent Fund) and the Available Workforce Education Fund (Available Fund) as special funds in the state treasury to support the Texas Technical College System. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Texas 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 69.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 10
measures.description: Provide a temporary homestead exemption for improvements made to residences destroyed by fire. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Texas 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 89.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 11
measures.description: Increase the property tax exemption from $10,000 to $60,000 of the market value for homesteads owned by elderly or disabled individuals. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Texas 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 78.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 12
measures.description: Change the composition of the state Commission on Judicial Conduct, provide for a temporary tribunal to review the commission's recommendations, and change the authority governing judicial misconduct. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Texas 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 62.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 13
measures.description: Increase the property tax exemption from $100,000 to $140,000 of the market value of a homestead. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Texas 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 79.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 14
measures.description: Establish the Dementia Prevention and Research Institute of Texas with $3 billion from the general fund. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Texas 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 69.0% voting yes.
measures.category: Healthcare governance; Administrative organization; Spending; Vaccinations and disease

measures.title: Proposition 15
measures.description: Provide that parents have the right "to exercise care, custody, and control of the parent’s child, including the right to make decisions concerning the child’s upbringing". This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Texas 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 70.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 16
measures.description: Amend the Texas Constitution to provide that "persons who are not citizens of the United States" cannot vote. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Texas 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 72.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 17
measures.description: Authorize the state legislature to provide for a property tax exemption for the construction of border infrastructure on property located in a county that borders Mexico. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Texas 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 57.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 2
measures.description: Prohibit a tax on the realized or unrealized capital gains of an individual, family, estate, or trust. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Texas 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 65.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 3
measures.description: Requires judges or magistrates to deny bail to individuals accused of certain violent or sexual offenses punishable as a felony if there is clear and convincing evidence that the accused will not reappear in court or is a danger to the community. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Texas 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 61.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 4
measures.description: Authorize the state legislature to allocate sales tax revenue that exceeds the first $46.5 billion with a maximum of $1 billion per fiscal year to the state water fund and authorize the state legislature, by a two-thirds vote, to adjust the amount allocated. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Texas 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 70.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 5
measures.description: Establish a property tax exemption on animal feed held by the owner of the property for retail sale. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Texas 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 64.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 6
measures.description: Prohibit the enactment of laws that impose taxes on entities that enter into transactions conveying securities or on certain securities transactions. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Texas 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 55.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 7
measures.description: Establish a property tax homestead exemption on all or part of the market value of the homestead of a surviving spouse of a veteran who died from a service-connected disease. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Texas 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 86.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 8
measures.description: Prohibit the state legislature from enacting laws imposing taxes on a decedent's property or the transfer of an estate. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Texas 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 72.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 9
measures.description: Authorize the state legislature to exempt $125,000 of the market value of personal tangible property used for income production from taxes. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Texas 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 65.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Senate Joint Resolution 8201
measures.description: Allow the Long-Term Services and Supports (LTSS) Trust Fund to be invested in stocks. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Washington 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 58.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Question 1
measures.description: Add a voter photo ID requirement to the Wisconsin Constitution. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Wisconsin 2025 ballot. Voters approved it with 63.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Ballot Measure 1
measures.description: Increase the state's minimum wage to $15 per hour and require employers to provide earned paid sick leave for employees. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the Alaska 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 58.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Ballot Measure 2
measures.description: Repeal the top-four ranked-choice voting (RCV) system that was adopted in 2020. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the Alaska 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 50.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Amendment 1
measures.description: Exempt local laws or local constitutional amendments from the budget isolation resolution process. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Alabama 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 49.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Amendment 1
measures.description: Authorize the Franklin County Board of Education to manage, sell, or lease lands and natural resources within the Franklin County School System located in Walker and Fayette Counties. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Alabama 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 74.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Issue 1
measures.description: Allow state lottery proceeds to fund scholarships and grants for vocational-technical schools and technical institutes. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Arkansas 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 90.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Issue 2
measures.description: Repeal the authorization for a casino license in Pope County and require countywide voter approval for any new casino licenses. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the Arkansas 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 56.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 133
measures.description: Require partisan primary elections for partisan offices and prohibit primary elections where all candidates, regardless of political party affiliation, run in the same primary election, such as top-two, top-four, and top-five primaries. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Arizona 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 42.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 134
measures.description: Create a signature distribution requirement for citizen-initiated ballot measures based on state legislative districts. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Arizona 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 42.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 135
measures.description: Allow the legislature to terminate a state of emergency or change the emergency powers granted to the governor during a state of emergency. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Arizona 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 44.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 136
measures.description: Provide for challenges to an initiative measure or constitutional amendment after the filing of the measure with the secretary of state. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Arizona 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 38.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 137
measures.description: End term limits for state supreme court justices and superior court judges, replacing them with terms of good behavior, unless decided otherwise by a judicial review commission, and would end retention elections at the end of the judicial term, providing for retention elections under certain circumstances. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Arizona 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 22.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 138
measures.description: Allow for tipped workers to be paid 25% less per hour than the minimum wage provided that the worker's total compensation was not less than the minimum wage plus $2. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Arizona 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 25.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 139
measures.description: Provide for a state constitutional right to abortion. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the Arizona 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 62.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 140
measures.description: Require primaries in which candidates, regardless of partisan affiliation, appear on a single ballot and a certain number advance to the general election, and require general election candidates to receive a majority of votes. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the Arizona 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 41.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 311
measures.description: Establish a $20 fee on every conviction for a criminal offense, which would go to pay a benefit of $250,000 to the family of a first responder who is killed in the line of duty. This legislative referendum was placed on the Arizona 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 64.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 312
measures.description: Allow for property owners to apply for a property tax refund in certain circumstances, including in instances if the city or locality in which the property is located does not enforce laws regarding illegal camping, loitering, obstructing public thoroughfares, panhandling, public urination or defecation, public consumption of alcoholic beverages, and possession or use of illegal substances. This legislative referendum was placed on the Arizona 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 59.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 313
measures.description: Require that anyone convicted of child sex trafficking must receive a sentence of life imprisonment. This legislative referendum was placed on the Arizona 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 65.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 314
measures.description: Provide for several changes to criminal and immigration law, including allowing police to arrest noncitizens who enter Arizona from foreign countries at locations other than official ports. This legislative referendum was placed on the Arizona 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 63.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 315
measures.description: Prohibit a proposed rule from becoming effective if that rule is estimated to increase regulatory costs by more than $500,000 within five years after implementation, until the legislature enacts legislation ratifying the proposed rule. This legislative referendum was placed on the Arizona 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 47.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Proposition 1

measures.description: Repeal Proposition 8 and establish a right to marry. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the California 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 63.0% voting yes.

measures.description: Provide for a state constitutional right to abortion and repeal provision banning the use of public funds for abortions. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the Colorado 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 62.0% voting yes.

measures.description: Provide that "each K-12 child has the right to school choice". This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the Colorado 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 49.0% voting yes.

measures.description: Prohibit trophy hunting, defined as "intentionally killing, wounding, pursuing, or entrapping a mountain lion, bobcat, or lynx; or discharging or releasing any deadly weapon at a mountain lion, bobcat, or lynx". measures.description: Issue $160.5 million in bonds for improvements to higher education facilities. This bond measure was placed on the Rhode Island 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 60.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Question 3
measures.description: Issue $120 million in bonds to increase the availability of housing in the state. This bond measure was placed on the Rhode Island 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 66.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Question 4
measures.description: Issue $53 million in bonds for environmental-related infrastructure, local recreation projects, and for preservation of land. This bond measure was placed on the Rhode Island 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 67.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Question 5
measures.description: Issue $10 million in bonds for funding for 1:1 matching grants to continue the Cultural Arts and Economy Grant program administered by the Rhode Island state council on the arts, and for improvements and renovations to the Tomaquag Museum, the Newport Contemporary Ballet, and the Trinity Repertory Company. This bond measure was placed on the Rhode Island 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 56.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Citizenship Requirement for Voting Amendment
measures.description: Prohibit the state and local governments from allowing noncitizens to vote. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the South Carolina 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 86.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Constitutional Amendment E
measures.description: Amend the constitution to change male pronouns in the Constitution to gender-neutral terms or titles. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the South Dakota 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 43.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Constitutional Amendment F
measures.description: Amend the South Dakota Constitution to provide that the state "may impose a work requirement on any person ... who has not been diagnosed as being physically or mentally disabled" for eligible individuals to receive Medicaid under the Medicaid expansion that took effect on July 1, 2023. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the South Dakota 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 56.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Constitutional Amendment G
measures.description: Provide for a state constitutional right to abortion with a trimester framework for regulations. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the South Dakota 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 41.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Constitutional Amendment H
measures.description: Establish top-two primaries for federal, state, and certain local offices in South Dakota. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the South Dakota 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 34.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Initiated Measure 28
measures.description: Prohibit state sales taxes on anything sold for human consumption, not including alcoholic beverages or prepared food. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the South Dakota 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 31.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Initiated Measure 29
measures.description: Legalize the recreational or personal use of marijuana. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the South Dakota 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 44.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Referred Law 21
measures.description: Uphold Senate Bill 201, which would provide requirements for regulating carbon dioxide pipelines and other transmission facilities, and allow counties to impose a surcharge on certain pipeline companies. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the South Dakota 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 41.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Amendment B
measures.description: Raise the annual distribution limit from the State School Fund for public education from 4% to 5%. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Utah 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 71.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Amendment C
measures.description: Establish in the state constitution that every county shall elect a sheriff to serve for four-year terms. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Utah 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 83.0% voting yes.

measures.number: Property Tax Exemption for Veterans and Surviving Spouses Amendment
measures.title: Property Tax Exemption for Veterans and Surviving Spouses Amendment
measures.description: Amend language in the Virginia Constitution regarding property tax exemptions for veterans and surviving spouses to say died in the line of duty rather than killed in action. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Virginia 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 93.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Initiative 2066
measures.description: Prohibit state and local governments from restricting access to natural gas. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the Washington 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 52.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Initiative 2109
measures.description: Repeal the capital gains excise tax imposed on long-term capital assets by individuals with capital gains over $250,000. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the Washington 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 36.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Initiative 2117
measures.description: Prohibit carbon tax credit trading and repeal provisions of the 2021 Washington Climate Commitment Act (CCA), a state law that provided for a cap and invest program designed to reduce greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions by 95% by 2050. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the Washington 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 38.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Initiative 2124
measures.description: Allow all employees and self-employed individuals to opt out of paying the tax and receiving benefits under WA Cares, the state's long-term services and supports trust health care program. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the Washington 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 45.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Citizenship Voting Requirement Amendment
measures.description: Prohibit the state and local governments from allowing noncitizens to vote. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Wisconsin 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 71.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Question 1
measures.description: Prohibit the legislature from delegating its power to appropriate money. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Wisconsin 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 43.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Question 1
measures.description: Prohibit any level of government in the state from applying or accepting non-governmental funds or equipment for election administration. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Wisconsin 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 54.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Question 2
measures.description: Provide that only election officials designated by law may administer elections. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Wisconsin 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 59.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Question 2
measures.description: Require legislative approval before the governor can expend federal money appropriated to the state. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Wisconsin 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 42.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Amendment 1
measures.description: Prohibit people from participating in "the practice of medically assisted suicide, euthanasia, or mercy killing of a person". This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the West Virginia 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 50.0% voting yes.

measures.number: Property Tax on Residential Property and Owner-Occupied Primary Residences Amendment
measures.title: Property Tax on Residential Property and Owner-Occupied Primary Residences Amendment
measures.description: Add residential real property as a fourth, separate, class of property and authorize the legislature to create a subclass of residential property for owner-occupied primary residences, which could be assessed at a rate other than the uniform rate for property in the class. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Wyoming 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 59.0% voting yes.
